intro: Eroteum boliviense, commonly known as the Bolivian eroteum, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas with acidic soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
